clinical_study.brief_title: Sirolimus in Combination With MEC in High Risk Myeloid Leukemias
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Single Institution Pilot Study Evaluating the Pharmacokinetics of Sirolimus in Combination With MEC (Mitoxantrone + Etoposide + Cytarabine) in Patients With High Risk Leukemias

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the side effects of sirolimus (rapamycin) given in combination with chemotherapy (Mitoxantrone + Etoposide + Cytarabine (MEC)) on high risk myeloid leukemias.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of biologic effects of rapamycin on mTOR targets such as p70 protein phosphorylation in leukemic cells

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of the sirolimus + MEC regimen

intervention.description: Rapamycin loading dose of 12 mg followed by a single daily dose for 8 days of 4 mg/day + MEC (Mitoxantrone 8 mg/m2/day IV, Etoposide 100 mg/m2/day IV and Cytarabine 1000 mg/m2 IV every 24 hours for 5 days. Starts after 4th dose of sirolimus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have histologic evidence of advanced myeloid leukemias defined as one of the following: primary refractory non-M3 AML; relapsed non-M3 AML; secondary AML; intermediate or poor prognosis de novo AML in patients who are >= 60 years old
- >= 18 years of age
- ECOG performance status of 0, 1
- Able to consume oral medication
- Initial laboratory values: creatinine <= 2.0 mg/dL; total or direct bilirubin <= 1.5/dL; SGPT(ALT) <= 3xULN; negative pregnancy test for women with child-bearing potential
- Ejection fraction of >= 45%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with FAM B3
- Must not be receiving chemotherapy (except Hydroxyurea)
- Not receiving growth factors, except for erythropoietin
- Subjects with a "currently active" second malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancers
- Subjects with uncontrolled high blood pressure, unstable angina, symptomatic congestive heart failure, MI within the last 6 months or uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia
- Subjects taking diltiazem
- Subjects who require HIV protease inhibitors or those with AIDS-related illnesses
- No evidence of cerebellar dysfunction at baseline or during prior cytarabine therapy
- Not pregnant or breastfeeding
- Uncontrolled infection
- Subjects taking Carbamazepine, Rifabutin, Rifampin, Rifapentine, St. John's wort, Clarithromycin, Cyclosporine, Diltiazem, Erythromycin, Telithromycin, Verapamil, Tacrolimus
